title: [Large-Scale] Material Design Optimization: Multi-Objective and Constraint-Based Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational materials science and engineering knowledge, along with college-level mathematics (calculus, statistics) proficiency
context.additional_context: Emphasizing practical approaches for solving real industrial problems through team-based project learning.

learning_goals: By the end of the six-month course, learners can create a 5-minute video presentation explaining the optimization process for multi-objective material design problems using three core Bayesian Optimization algorithms (EI, UCB, PI) with over 80% accuracy, and submit a 10-page case study report applying the MPI-Material-JSON dataset to achieve over 85 points on the evaluation rubric (30% algorithm applicability, 30% data analysis accuracy, 40% report completeness).

Learners can analyze material design problems reflecting high-temperature gas turbine manufacturing conditions (up to 1,200Â°C, 500-hour durability), propose three or more material candidates (nickel-based superalloys, ceramic composites, silicon carbide) using ANSYS Workbench or Abaqus FEA tools, and submit a design plan within three weeks that meets four or more of the five technical feasibility checklist items (thermal expansion coefficient, creep resistance, oxidation stability, fatigue strength, thermal conductivity).
Performance of material property evaluation through DFT (Density Functional Theory)-based performance metric analysis
Development of Pareto-front analysis and decision-making skills using multi-objective optimization results
Execution of projects linking material design optimization outcomes to real-world industrial applications

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
